Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Douglas Kellum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on November 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

$440.00 Restitution on behalf of Jeremy Kellum plus 10% surcharge of $44.00 totals $484.00 to be paid to the Clerk of Court office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on November 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on November 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
